stark_settings.description: Input parameters for the IDL STARK code

coll.description: Data relevant to the Collection optics

xyz.description: The xyz-coordinates - in the machine coordinate system - of the collection lens.

k.description: The xyz-coordinates - in the machine coordinate system - of the k-vector of the collection lens. This is the vector describing the optical axis and in the direction from the emission volume towards the collection lens. REMARK: the collection lens coordinate system is given by: (k,l,m), with k the unit vector given here, l=zxk/|zxk| - z being the z of the machine coordinate system - and m=kxl. This means that k-coordinates are along the optical axis, l coordinates are horizontal and m-coordinates are - usually - more or less vertical (if the optical axis is more or less horizontal).

d.description: The diameter of the collection lens.

efl.description: Effective focal length of the collection lens (This is linked with the alpha - the opening angle that corresponds with 1 mm on the fibre plate - through: efl = 1/tan(alpha) ).

fibre.description: Diameter of the optical core of the fibre and the diameter of the total fibre. (for etendue)

bundleID.description: The IDs of each fibre bundle. E.g. for MAST the MSE fibre bundles are named: MD142, MD142, ..., MD181. REMARK: The xml-nodes further down in this file describing l- and m-coordinates of the fibres in each fibrebundle should be named with this ID and the number of nodes should correspond with (twice, one for l-, one for m-coordinates) the number of elements in this ID-list.

MD142l.description: l-coordinates in mm of the fibres in this fibrebundle

MD142m.description: m-coordinates in mm of the fibres in this fibrebundle
